conversion_verification.notes: The second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, floors are planar, multiple wall faces are visible, and the roof/ceiling is removed to expose interior spaces. View is slightly angled (not perfectly orthographic), with shadows and visible wall side faces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall massing and clean cutaway. View is only mildly angled (close to top-down), reducing perceived verticality slightly, but still clearly 3D.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches (dining top-left, kitchen top-center, entrance top-right, living right, bedroom bottom-left, stairs bottom-right). Main concern is the central wash/toilet zone: the 2D indicates a clearer separation between wash area and toilet than the 3D shows. Minor discrepancies likely in some door/window counts/placements.

interior_elements.notes: Dining set, living seating, bed, and bathroom fixtures are present and placed in appropriate rooms. Kitchen is simplified (limited cabinetry/appliances detail), but sink/counter indication exists.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render, readable geometry, openings and walls are distinguishable, good lighting, no major mesh artifacts, and no UI/text contamination in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Wash area vs toilet separation/partitioning appears simplified or altered compared to the 2D plan, reducing fidelity of the central service-core layout.
Some door/window placements and/or counts appear to differ slightly from the 2D plan (notably around internal doors and small openings), though most major openings are present.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with the main geometric deviation being the simplified/altered wash-toilet partitioning and minor opening mismatches.
